เรื่องดราม่าในวันหยุดจุดประกายการถกเถียงใหม่ถึงสาเหตุที่แท้จริงของการดิ่งลงในวันที่ 10 ตุลาคม

Weekend Drama Rekindles Debate Over What Really Caused the October 10 Crash

4d ago//Editorial
general
AI

Summary

TH

การโต้เถียงระหว่างผู้บริหารแพลตฟอร์มคริปโตหลังจากเหตุการณ์คริปโตตลาดตกครั้งใหญ่ในวันที่ 10 ตุลาคม ทำให้เกิดการถกเถียงกันใหม่เกี่ยวกับสาเหตุที่แท้จริง ประธานเจ้าหน้าที่ของ OKX ระบุว่าการตกครั้งนี้เริ่มจาก USDe (สเตเบิลคอยน์ของ Ethena) ที่เสียมูลค่าบน Binance ทำให้เกิดการขายตัดกำไรแบบคลื่นกระทบไปทั่วตลาด อย่างไรก็ตาม ผู้เชี่ยวชาญจาก Dragonfly และ Wintermute แย้งว่าปัจจัยเศรษฐศาสตร์เป็นสาเหตุหลัก โดยชี้ให้เห็นว่า Bitcoin มีการขายลงก่อนที่ USDeจะแสดงปัญหาแล้ว และถ้าหาก USDe เป็นสาเหตุระบบ การเสียมูลค่าควรจะเห็นได้ทุกแพลตฟอร์มไม่ใช่แค่ Binance เท่านั้น

EN

A public dispute between exchange executives has reignited debate over the causes of the October 10 crypto crash. OKX CEO Star Xu claims the crash was triggered by Binance's handling of USDe, a yield-bearing stablecoin that lost its peg, causing cascading liquidations. However, this explanation is challenged by Dragonfly's Haseeb Qureshi and Wintermute's Evgeny Gaevoy, who argue macro factors were the primary cause. Qureshi points out that Bitcoin was already selling off before USDe showed stress, and a true systemic trigger would have affected all exchanges, not just Binance. Gaevoy describes it as a macro-driven flash crash exacerbated by thin liquidity and liquidation engine mechanics that prioritize solvency over stability.

Key Points

  • OKX CEO blames Binance's handling of USDe stablecoin for triggering the October 10 crash
  • Industry analysts point to macro factors as the primary cause, noting Bitcoin was already declining before USDe issues
  • Debate highlights whether the crash was triggered by a specific stablecoin or broader systemic issues in the highly leveraged crypto market

Article

A public dispute between exchange executives and market makers has reignited debate over whether leverage, stablecoins, or macro forces were to blame for October’s historic crash. Posted February 2, 2026 at 6:48 am EST. Crypto Twitter lit up this weekend as old wounds reopened over what actually caused the October 10 liquidation cascade , one of the most violent crashes the market has ever seen. The spark came from OKX CEO Star Xu, who argued that the crash stemmed from Binance’s handling of USDe , a yield-bearing token issued by Ethena. Xu said a high-APY campaign, combined with allowing USDe to be used as collateral like USDT or USDC, encouraged leverage loops that quietly built systemic risk. When volatility hit, he argued, USDe briefly lost its peg on Binance, setting off cascading liquidations that rippled across the market. This story is an excerpt from the Unchained Daily newsletter . Subscribe here to get these updates in your email for free That framing was quickly challenged. Dragonfly’s managing partner Haseeb Qureshi pushed back hard , calling the Binance-centric explanation misleading. His core point: the timeline doesn’t fit . Bitcoin had already sold off and liquidations were underway well before USDe showed stress on Binance. Just as importantly, USDe only diverged on one venue. A truly systemic trigger, Qureshi argued, would have shown up everywhere, as seen in events like Terra or FTX. Adding weight to that view, Wintermute CEO Evgeny Gaevoy also rejected the idea that Binance was the root cause. He described October 10 as a macro-driven flash crash in an extremely leveraged market, made worse by thin liquidity, API outages, and liquidation engines that prioritize solvency over stability.
